title: 3 Simple Ways to Completely Power Down Your iPad or iPad Pro

steps.title: Press and hold either volume button and the top button at the same time.
steps.content: Press and hold either volume button and the top button at the same time. Do this until you see the power off slider. [1] X Research source If your iPad has a Home button, you'll just need to press and hold the top button until the power off slider appears.

steps.title: Drag the "power off" slider to the right.
steps.content: Drag the "power off" slider to the right. This will power off your iPad.

steps.title: Wait at least 30 seconds.
steps.content: Wait at least 30 seconds. It may take a moment for your iPad to fully power off. If the physical buttons aren't working on your iPad, you can use the settings instead.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the grey cog icon. If you can't use the buttons on your iPad, you can shut it down from its settings instead.

steps.title: Tap General.
steps.content: Tap General . You can find this in the left panel.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Shut Down.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Shut Down . This is in blue text at the very bottom of the page.

steps.title: Slide the "power off" switch.
steps.content: Slide the "power off" switch. This will turn off your iPad. Be sure to wait at least 30 seconds to make sure it's fully off.

steps.title: Understand when this is necessary.
steps.content: Understand when this is necessary. You should only need to force-restart your iPad if it's frozen or otherwise unresponsive to the "Sleep/Wake" button. [2] X Research source Force-restarting your iPad can cause some apps to crash, and you may lose any unsaved work.

steps.title: Quickly press and release the volume button closest to the top button.
steps.content: Quickly press and release the volume button closest to the top button. This will vary depending on your iPad model. [3] X Research source If your iPad has a Home button, simply press and hold the top button and Home button at the same time. Release both buttons when the Apple logo appears.

steps.title: Quickly press and release the volume button farthest from the top button.
steps.content: Quickly press and release the volume button farthest from the top button. This will vary depending on your iPad model.

steps.title: Press and hold the top button.
steps.content: Press and hold the top button. This is the iPad's lock button. Wait for the Apple logo to appear.

steps.title: Release the top button.
steps.content: Release the top button. You should see your iPad's lock screen in a few moments. You can now perform a regular shut down.

steps.title: Press and hold either volume button and the top button at the same time.
steps.content: Press and hold either volume button and the top button at the same time. Do this until you see the power off slider. If your iPad has a Home button, you'll just need to press and hold the top button until the power off slider appears.

steps.title: Drag the slider to the right.
steps.content: Drag the slider to the right. This will power off your iPad. Be sure to wait at least 30 seconds to make sure it's fully off.
